data.text:
A circular dining or center table designed by John Vesey in 1958. The barrel-form base of the table is fabricated from slightly bent bands of aluminum and brass and the addition of the burled wood top is original to the table. The table was acquired from Mid Century residence in Palm Springs and was ordered from Vesey by acclaimed interior designer Arthur Elrod in the 1960s. The top of the table retains its original finish and sun bleached color.

Condition

EXCELLENT, wear consistent with age and use

Measurements

42" diam x 28.5" h
